Articles.Content: Although it's not really technical support, I  want to know if a yoke that you hook up to a computer will work with KSP. I don't have one, but I am looking for one for Microsoft Flight Simulator X (FSX) and KSP (If it will actually work with KSP).

It should do (you might not have all the functions of the yoke but the basics should work) as regardless of the shape, it’s really just sending a signal which means “turn left” or “dive”. It’s whether that signal is interpreted correctly is the issue of course. And as a caveat, apparently KSP doesn’t always play nicely with some joysticks but I’ve used an Xbox controller on both ksp and fsx without issues. I suppose even if it doesn’t work, you can still use it for fsx so not all lost.
Ok, thanks! I thought it would work, but I just wasn't sure how KSP would work with one. Now all I need to do is actually get a yoke!
